Package uk.ac.open.crc.intt

INTT is a concise API for tokenising identifier names that consists of two classes: a tokeniser; and a factory, which allows for the configuration and creation of tokeniser instances.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
IdentifierNameTokeniser Provides a simple interface for tokenising identifier names.
IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory Provides an API for configuring and creating IdentifierNameTokeniser objects.
 

Package uk.ac.open.crc.intt Description

INTT is a concise API for tokenising identifier names that consists of two classes: a tokeniser; and a factory, which allows for the configuration and creation of tokeniser instances.

INTT was designed to tokenise identifier names extracted from Java source code. In the default configuration, INTT will tokenise identifier names composed from English language words that optionally use the '$' and '_' separator characters.

Configuration

INTT can be configured to use alternative dictionaries and sets of separator characters making it possible to tokenise identifier names extracted from most programming languages constructed from words and abbreviations in most natural languages. See IdentifierNameTokeniserFactory for more details.

Copyright (C) 2011 The Open University
